content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey is eating breakfast as Rachel enters, having just woken up.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Morning!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! Oh, how was your date last night?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pretty good.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh good. (She walks to the closed bathroom door, opens it, and finds a naked woman wrapped in a towel.) Ahhh! My God, sorry! (She closes the door and confronts Joey.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, really good. Anyway I gotta go; I’m late for work.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What-what?! You’re gonna leave this person with me?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah—Hey, don’t worry, she’s a terrific girl. And hey listen, could you do me a favor? When she comes out could you just mention that I’m not looking for a serious relationship; that’d be great.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why?! What?! Are you kidding?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Just casually slip it in, y’know lay the groundwork. Tell her uh, I’m a loner—No! An outlaw! Tell her she doesn’t want to get mixed up with the likes of me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know what? That’s a lot to remember, can’t I just tell her you’re a pig?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, I’m gonna call her later! Honest! Oh come on, Chandler used to do it! He’d even make the girl pancakes! Plus, he’d make extras and leave ‘em for me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well forget it, I’m not telling that girl anything. That is not my responsibility.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Fine! (Pause) Now, where’d we land on those pancakes? (She chases him out the door as his date emerges from the bathroom.)

content.speaker: Joey’s Date
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Joey’s Date
content.text: Sorry about that, but I couldn’t get that lock to work on the door.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, Joey kinda disabled it when I moved in.

content.speaker: Joey’s Date
content.text: You must be Rachel, I’m Erin.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: Hi. I don’t mean this to sound like high school, but did he say anything about me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Would you like some pancakes?

content.description: N.Y.U’s University Library, Ross is entering with Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …Come on! Why are we here?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, okay take a guess.
(An old woman pushes a cart full of books past.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The hot chicks?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, okay, I was typing names into the library computer earlier, y’know-y’know for fun, and I typed mine in and guess what came up? My doctoral dissertation! It’s here! Yeah, it’s right-it’s right down here! In the biggest library in the university! (They start heading that way, towards a secluded section behind the racks.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow that’s actually pretty cool.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh umm, there’s also a book here by a woman named Wendy Bagina. (They both laugh, but stop when the hear moaning coming from the next aisle.) What is that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sounds like two people are really enjoying the Dewey decimal system.

(They go around the last row of bookshelves and find a couple doing what college coeds do in secluded corners of university libraries. For those of you who don’t know what I’m talking about, let’s just say that clothing is undone. Ross gasps and the couple gets up and runs away.)

content.speaker: Female Student
content.text: I’m so sorry!
content.parenthetical: as they are moving past Ross

content.speaker: Male Student
content.text: Sorry!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You didn’t bring me here to do that, did you?

content.description: Monica’s Restaurant Kitchen, Monica is cooking as a waitress enters carrying a plate of food that has been sent back.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: She sent the chicken back again?!

content.speaker: The Waitress
content.text: She says it’s too dry now and she wants to come back here and explain to you exactly how she wants it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well fine! I want to meet this chicken expert! Send the Colonel in!

content.speaker: The Colonel
content.text: OH…MY…GAWD!!!! (Yep, it’s Janice.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Lucky bastard! (Throws the lobster in and turns around to face the planet’s most annoying woman, next to Dr. Laura and Kathy Lee Gifford of course. She’s the most annoying female TV character however.) Janice.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: How are you Ms. Hot Shot chef with the big fancy restaurant with the best chicken ever! (Does the laugh.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m fine.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Ohh! What is that on your finger?! I’m blind!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh… Uh…

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: So, who’s the lucky guy?
[Cut to Monica and Chandler’s just after Monica has finished telling Chandler what happened.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OH…MY…GAWD! I am so sorry sweetie, are you okay? You didn’t tell her we were getting married, did you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, she saw the ring.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Did she freak out?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, she was shocked when I told her, but then again so were most people.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, she actually has a boyfriend y’know herself, named Clark. Uh, she also kinda invited herself to our wedding. Clark too.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You said no, right?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Huh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You said no, right?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, she cornered me! She asked if the wedding was in town! I mean, what was I supposed to do?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Lie!!! How hard is that?! The check’s in the mail! Oh your baby is so cute! I can’t wait to read your book, Ross!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on! So she comes to the wedding! I mean it won’t be so bad.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What do you think, she’s just gonna sit there quietly? You don’t think she’s gonna want to make a toast? You don’t think she’s gonna want to grab the microphone and sing Part-time Lover ?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, she’s not gonna like the chicken that night either, is she?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what? It’s gonna be okay. Y’know what? She’s probably not gonna even want to come.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! That was a lie ! See how easy that was?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So-so you would’ve just lied?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Would it really have been that easy?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes!!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Good, so do it Saturday night because we’re going to dinner with her and Clark.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey is coming back from work to find Phoebe, Rachel, and someone else with her back turned, are there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! What’s up?

content.speaker: Phoebe and Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey, who’s your friend? (Erin turns around to face Joey, startling him) Hey!!

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: Hey Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Erin! Still here!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, we ended up spending the day together and had such a great time!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why wouldn’t ya? Erin is great! Then-then there’s you guys.

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: Ohh, listen. I’ve got to get going. Today was great, thanks!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: Bye Joey. (Kisses him.) Last night was fun.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. I’ll uh, I’ll call ya.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh and I’ll call ya too!

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: Or I’ll call you!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And call me!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, good to see you again.

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Bye-bye.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Bye!
(Joey closes the door behind her.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So, system kinda broke down huh?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Joey, I’m sorry I just couldn’t tell her all those things you wanted me to tell her. And y’know we got to talking and I…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We want you to marry her!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: She is so amazing! You have no idea.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No idea? Who do you think brought her here?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Cupid.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Joey, she’s so cool. She speaks four languages.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Man, do you know what guys want!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look Joey, come on, she’s so perfect for you! I mean, she’s sweet, she-she likes baseball, and she-she had two beers at lunch.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: My beers?! Look you guys, she’s a very nice girl. Okay? We had a good time, but I just—I don’t see it going anywhere.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but you always say that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, maybe if you gave this girl a chance it would go somewhere.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, I’m sorry you guys, I-I just don’t think so.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Whatever.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Fine. (They start to walk away.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, don’t start judging me! (To Rachel) Huh? You’re the one who’s in love with her assistant! (To Phoebe) Huh? And you, you’re the one having the affair with the guy who keeps the pigeons on the roof!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Secret affair!

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel and Joey are there as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: People are doing it in front of my book!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My doctoral dissertation is in the library at school, I went to see it, and there were students makin’ babies right in the middle of the Paleontology section!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! Did you get to see anything good?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Let me ask you something, at your school was there a like uh a place on campus where students went to uh, fool around.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, there was. It was—there the corner of the library where-where all these dusty books that nobody ever read—Yes, there was.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Great! Because people kept showing up, I think it’s like uh-a thing!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Now hold on a second, fifth floor against that back wall?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh for cryin’ out loud! (He storms out.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, so we should go catch our movie.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well now what’s the rush?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I like to see the previews. (Rachel looks at him.) The candy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well look who’s here!

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Erin.

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: Hey Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! Well, we were just about to take off and see a movie. Oh no!

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: What’s wrong?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Phoebe, we forgot that party we have to go to.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What party?

content.speaker: Phoebe and Rachel
content.text: A birthday party.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who’s birthday party?

content.speaker: Phoebe and Rachel
content.text: Alison’s birthday party.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, and how old is Alison?

content.speaker: Phoebe and Rachel
content.text: 32. (Joey’s not buying it.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wait a minute! Why don’t you guys do something?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, look how that worked out.

content.description: The Library, Ross enters and heads to the desk to talk to the male librarian on duty.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Excuse me. Hi, I’m a professor here. Do you know the Paleontology section, fifth floor, stack 437?

content.speaker: The Librarian
content.text: Well, yes! Just give me five minutes, I just have to find someone to cover my shift.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! No!! No! Can I speak to someone in charge please?! (The librarian brings his boss over.)

content.speaker: The Head Librarian
content.text: How can I help you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi, I was wondering if it is possible to increase security in the Paleontology section? See I-I wrote a book up there and instead of reading it people are-are-are well, rolling around in front of it.

content.speaker: The Head Librarian
content.text: We are aware of the problem you are referring to. (He turns to look at the previous librarian.) But as far as increasing security, I’m afraid the library is very understaffed. I, I can’t help you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, fine. Fine! If-if I’m the only person with any appreciation of the sanctity of the written word, I’ll go up there and defend it myself! (Starts to do so, but stops and to the previous librarian) And don’t you follow me!

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Rachel and Phoebe are doing dishes as Joey enters.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How did it go with Erin?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, unbelievable! We had the best time!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yay!! Oh so, you’re not, you’re not mad at us anymore?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! No! No! You guys were totally right! This is so much better than the first time we went out. Y’know? That was so awkward, we were really nervous.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Didn’t you sleep together?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, that really calms me down. And! We have so much in common! She loves sandwiches, sports, although she is a Met fan, not much of an issue now but if we were ever to have kids, well that’s a…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! Listen to you talkin’ about having kids. Oh my Joey. (She goes over and hugs him.) Oh, please don’t get married before I do.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.

content.description: A Restaurant, Monica and Chandler are on their date with Janice and Clark, however Clark is a no show and Janice is crying the Mississippi River about it.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh. Oh I just cannot believe Clark stood me up!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He might still show up.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh, what are you, stupid? It’s been three hours.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is that all?

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: I should just go on to happier things, okay? Umm, why don’t you tell about your lovely wedding?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well actually uh, there was something we wanted to tell you about the wedding. Um, it’s going to be a small ceremony. Uh, tiny! We’re not even sure why we’re having it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s actually going to be just family.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh…wait…you two think of me as family?! Oh, I have to ask you something now and be honest; do you want me to sing Careless Whisper or Lady In Red ?

content.description: Central Perk, Joey is entering and arguing baseball with Erin. Phoebe and Rachel are already there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How can you say that?! The Mets have no closer!

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: What about Benitez?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What about Game 1 of the Series?

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: What about shut up?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You shut up! (To Phoebe and Rachel) I love arguing with her. (To Erin) I’ll be right back.

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: Okay. (Joey goes to get some coffee and Erin sits down.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So how’s it goin’ with Joey?

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: Uh, okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay? Wait okay, tell-tell me that you like him, please? I mean tell me that you like him.

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: Look, he’s a really great guy and I know that you really want this to work out, but I just don’t see this having a future.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But you said that you liked him! I mean what happened?! Did ya just change your mind?!

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: Kinda.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Then change it back!

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: I’m sorry I… It’s just there’s no real spark.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No spark? Didn’t you sleep together?

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh, tramp!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Does Joey have any idea?

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: I really don’t think he does. And y’know what? Maybe you guys could help clue him in. Y’know, tell him I’m-I’m not interested in a serious relationship or something.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, you mean like that you’re kind of a loner.

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: Yeah! That would be great!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, and maybe that you’re a real (She says something in Italian, and it doesn’t matter what she said. It’s not important so I don’t need everyone who speaks Italian telling me what she said.)

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: I’m sorry?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh well, I guess Italian isn’t one of the four languages you speak.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! You wanna go?

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: Yeah, let’s go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. See you guys later.

content.speaker: Erin
content.text: Bye guys.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, see ya.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, thank you so much. (They both exit.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow. Well, I guess it was Cupid who brought her here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, just a regular old flying dwarf.

content.description: The library’s Paleontology section, Ross is patrolling as a couple walks up.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes? Yes?! How can I help you?

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Yeah, we were…we were just looking around.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh-oh, you’re-you’re fellow scholars. What exactly were you looking for, hmm? Perhaps, (Grabs a book from the shelf behind him) perhaps Dr. Chester Stock’s musings on the Smiledon Californicus?

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Uhh…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah… Ah…Get out of here! (The couple retreats. Ross starts looking through the previously mentioned book as a beautiful woman walks into the section.) Uh, meeting someone? Or-or are you just here to brush up on Marion’s views on evolution?

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Uh, actually I find Marion’s views far too progressionist.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I find Marion’s views far too progressionist.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: I’m sorry, who are you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m a professor here uh, Ross…Geller.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Ross Geller, why do I know that name? It’s uh—Wait! (Grabs his book off of the shelf.) Did you write this?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes! You’re the person who checked out my book?!

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Y’know, you look nothing like I would’ve thought. You’re…you’re so young.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well I uh, I skipped forth grade.
[Time Lapse, Ross and the woman are now in a state of partial undress and are standing in front of the head librarian with two security guards watching them.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I am very…very sorry.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Phoebe and Rachel are watching TV as Joey enters.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So how was, how was your date?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, it was great! I mean we walked all around the village. We went to this ice cream place, split a milkshake, 70/30 but still… And guess what, I’m thinking about taking her upstate to one of those bed and breakfasts.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh really? She said she wants to go away with you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no-no-no-no! It’s a surprise, but it’s gonna be tricky though because she said she was gonna be pretty busy at work for a while.

content.speaker: Phoebe and Rachel
content.text: Oh no, yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Jo-Joey, look honey we-we need to talk okay? Umm, I kinda got the feeling from her today that uh, she’s not lookin’ for a serious relationship.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Where are you gettin’ this?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, she told me. She said she’s kind of a loner.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh. Oh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No hey Rach, it’s cool okay? Y’know I’m a loner too! (Heads for his room.) Right?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey Joey, y’know what? You are way too good for her.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah and honey I promise next time that I will just say good-bye and tell ‘em you’re not looking for a relationship.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! No. Don’t do that, just next time make sure she really likes me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well that too. (Joey goes into his room.) Joey?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Do you want some pancakes?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Finally!

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Chandler and Monica are sitting at the kitchen table and are still trying to decide what to do about Janice.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are we gonna do?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I say we go with Careless Whisper .
(There’s a knock on the door and Janice enters.)

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Chandler?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Did she see us yet? Did she see us?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Janice, what umm, what are you doing here?

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Well umm, I thought I was going to go back to my apartment but then I just felt I couldn’t really be alone tonight. (Joey walks into view of the open door behind Janice, sees her, gets a terrified look on his face, and flees in horror.) I was wondering if I could maybe stay here with you, just I really feel that I need to be with family.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Our kids are gonna call her Aunt Janice aren’t they?

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Please, it’s because otherwise I really don’t know what I might do.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Aren’t you just a tinsy bit curious?

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Do you have any tissues?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, in-in-in the bathroom.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Okay! (She runs for the bathroom)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’ll just…we’ll just let her stay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no-no-no, if we let her stay, she will stay forever !

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Kinda like your barcalounger.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is that what you’re thinking about right now?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I never stop thinking about it.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Hey you guys, umm do either one of you want to get in there before I take my bath.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Janice, I’m sorry but umm, you can’t stay here tonight.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Honestly? Our apartment is a hotbed for electromagnetic activity. Now Monica and I have been immunized, but sadly you have not.
(And she does the laugh.)

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Okay, I’m going to need a comforter, but did you have a hypoallergenic one because otherwise I get very nasal. (Makes some weird sound) Do you have a cat? ‘Cause it’s already happening. (Makes a nasal sound) Do you hear that? (She keeps making the nasal sound.)
(Chandler does the same nasal sound to Chandler.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! Oh my God! You have to go!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because Chandler still has feelings for you!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: He does?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Say again?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s right. That’s right. And that is why you can’t stay here tonight. And probably why you shouldn’t come to the wedding.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Feelings, such strong feelings.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I mean, I realize that his feelings may never completely go away, but you can.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh…my Gawd, I-I understand. I-I am so sorry, I’ll go. (Starts for the door.) Good-bye Monica (hugs her), I wish you a lifetime of happiness with him. Chandler, (hugs him) you call me when this goes in the pooper. (Hurries out.)

content.description: The library’s Paleontology section, Ross is on patrol and stops a security guard through the stack of books.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Don’t sweat it, I’ve got this section covered. Yeah, in fact I’ve got this little baby (Turns on a mini-flashlight) to shine in people’s eye—(The guard walks away)—Okay, see you later.
(Ross resumes his patrol when his best friend and sister walk up and start to take off their coats, but they stop when they see him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I just wanted to show Monica your book. (Ross just glares at him.)
